DOC.brief_summary: Observational study demonstrate overweight pregnancy risk factor adverse pregnancy outcome fetal macrosomia , prolonged labor , low Apgar score , shoulder dystocia , nerve plexus injury , increase proportion instrumental delivery perineal rupture . There 2.6 fold risk gestational diabetes mellitus ( fourfold morbidly obese woman ) recent study show fetus obese mother develop insulin resistance uterus . Main aim study assess regular exercise pregnancy among obese woman prevent influence weight gain ; impaired cardiac function mother fetus/newborn ; impaired vascular function mother ; insulin resistance/sensitivity ; body composition mother offspring ; lumbopelvic pain ; urinary and/or fecal incontinence ; prolong labor
DOC.detailed_description: Women self-reported pre-pregnancy BMI 28 eligible study . Woman eligible 18 year old , singleton live fetus early ( week 12-14 ) ultrasound scan . Exclusion criterion pregnancy complication high risk preterm labour disease could interfere participation . Primary outcome measure weight increase base weight measure 14 week immediately labour . Assessments do baseline 14 ( 12-18 ) week pregnancy , week 38 , well 3 month postpartum . Some measurement also do point time . The maternal secondary outcome measurement include fast glucose , glucose tolerance assess 2-h , 75 mg per-oral glucose tolerance test , insulin resistance assess HOMA-IR , weight , height , body composition estimate skinfold measurement pregnancy dual energy x-ray absorptiometry postpartum , blood marker , lumbopelvic pain , urin- fecal incontinence , quality life , psychological wellbeing , depression , diet .
DOC.criteria: Prepregnancy body mass index 28 18 year singleton live fetus routine ultrasound scan high risk preterm labor disease could interfere participation
